asteroids.part1.facade

Interface IFacade

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IFacade, IFacade
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Facade

    public interface IFacade
    Implement this interface to connect your code to the graphical user interface (GUI).
    • For separating the code that you wrote from the code that was provided to you, put ALL your code in the src folder. The code that is provided to you stays in the src-provided folder. Only if you modify the provided code, it's advised to move the modified code to the src folder, so that your changes cannot be accidentally overwritten by an updated version of the provided code.
    • You should at least create the following classes in the package asteroids.model:
      • a class Ship for representing a space ship
      You may, of course, add additional classes as you see fit.
    • You should create a class Facade that implements this interface. This class should be placed in the package asteroids.facade.
    • The header of that Facade class should look as follows:
      class Facade implements IFacade { ... }
      Consult the Java tutorial for more information on interfaces, if necessary.
    • Your Facade class should offer a default constructor.
    • Each method defined in the interface IFacade must be implemented by the class Facade. For example, the implementation of getShipRadius(Ship) should call one or more methods on the given ship to retrieve its current radius.
    • Methods in this interface are only allowed to throw exceptions of type asteroids.util.ModelException (this class is provided). No other exception types are allowed. This exception can only be thrown if (1) calling a method of your Ship class with the given parameters would violate a precondition, or (2) if the method of your Ship class throws an exception (if so, wrap the exception in a ModelException).
    • ModelException should not be used anywhere outside of your Facade implementation.
    • Your Facade implementation should only contain trivial code (for example, calling a method, combining multiple return values into an array, creating @Value instances, catching exceptions and wrapping it in a ModelException). All non-trivial code should be placed in the other classes that you create.
    • The rules described above and the documentation described below for each method apply only to the class implementing IFacade. Your Ship class should follow the rules described in the assignment.
    • Do not modify the signatures of the methods defined in this interface.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Ship createShip()
      Create a new ship with a default position, velocity, radius and direction.
      Ship createShip(double x, double y, double xVelocity, double yVelocity, double radius, double orientation)
      Create a new ship with the given position, velocity, radius and orientation (in radians).
      double[] getCollisionPosition(Ship ship1, Ship ship2)
      Return the first position where ship1 and ship2 collide, or null if they never collide.
      double getDistanceBetween(Ship ship1, Ship ship2)
      Return the distance between ship1 and ship2.
      double getShipOrientation(Ship ship)
      Return the orientation of ship (in radians).
      double[] getShipPosition(Ship ship)
      Return the position of ship as an array of length 2, with the x-coordinate at index 0 and the y-coordinate at index 1.
      double getShipRadius(Ship ship)
      Return the radius of ship.
      double[] getShipVelocity(Ship ship)
      Return the velocity of ship as an array of length 2, with the velocity along the X-axis at index 0 and the velocity along the Y-axis at index 1.
      double getTimeToCollision(Ship ship1, Ship ship2)
      Return the number of seconds until the first collision between ship1 and ship2, or Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY if they never collide.
      void move(Ship ship, double dt)
      Update ship's position, assuming it moves dt seconds at its current velocity.
      boolean overlap(Ship ship1, Ship ship2)
      Check whether ship1 and ship2 overlap.
      void thrust(Ship ship, double amount)
      Update ship's velocity based on its current velocity, its direction and the given amount.
      void turn(Ship ship, double angle)
      Update the direction of ship by adding angle (in radians) to its current direction.

    • Method Detail

      • createShip

        Ship createShip()
         throws ModelException
        Create a new ship with a default position, velocity, radius and direction. Result is a unit circle centered on (0, 0) facing right. Its speed is zero.
        Throws:
        ModelException

      • createShip

        Ship createShip(double x,
                double y,
                double xVelocity,
                double yVelocity,
                double radius,
                double orientation)
         throws ModelException
        Create a new ship with the given position, velocity, radius and orientation (in radians).
        Throws:
        ModelException

        Throws:
        ModelException

        Throws:
        ModelException

      • turn

        void turn(Ship ship,
          double angle)
   throws ModelException
        Update the direction of ship by adding angle (in radians) to its current direction. angle may be negative.
        Throws:
        ModelException

      • getDistanceBetween

        double getDistanceBetween(Ship ship1,
                          Ship ship2)
                   throws ModelException
        Return the distance between ship1 and ship2. The absolute value of the result of this method is the minimum distance either ship should move such that both ships are adjacent. Note that the result must be negative if the ships overlap. The distance between a ship and itself is 0.
        Throws:
        ModelException

      • overlap

        boolean overlap(Ship ship1,
                Ship ship2)
         throws ModelException
        Check whether ship1 and ship2 overlap. A ship always overlaps with itself.
        Throws:
        ModelException

      • getTimeToCollision

        double getTimeToCollision(Ship ship1,
                          Ship ship2)
                   throws ModelException
        Return the number of seconds until the first collision between ship1 and ship2, or Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY if they never collide. A ship never collides with itself.
        Throws:
        ModelException

      • getCollisionPosition

        double[] getCollisionPosition(Ship ship1,
                              Ship ship2)
                       throws ModelException
        Return the first position where ship1 and ship2 collide, or null if they never collide. A ship never collides with itself. The result of this method is either null or an array of length 2, where the element at index 0 represents the x-coordinate and the element at index 1 represents the y-coordinate.
        Throws:
        ModelException
